  • Element
org.yamcs.http.api

Annotation Type Route


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Repeatable(value=Routes.class)
public @interface Route

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String path
      Currently must be an absolute path.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean dataLoad
      Data load routes expect to receive a large body and they receive it piece by piece in HttpContent objects.
      int maxBodySize 
      String[] method
      HTTP method or methods by which this rule is available.
      boolean offThread
      Set true if the execution of the route is expected to take a long time (more than 0.5 seconds).
      boolean priority
      Whether this route must be checked before any other route.

    • Element Detail

      • path

        public abstract String path
        Currently must be an absolute path. Specify route params by preceding them with a colon, followed by their identifying name.

      • method

        public abstract String[] method
        HTTP method or methods by which this rule is available. By default set to "GET".

        Implementation note: can't use netty's HttpMethod because it's not an enum

        Default:
        "GET"

      • priority

        public abstract boolean priority
        Whether this route must be checked before any other route. Used to differentiate a route when it's identifying part overlaps with the route params of another route.

        When matching the request URI, the first rule with the highest weight that matches is responsible for handling the request.

        FYI: The order of java methods is non-deterministic when accessing them through reflection. We implement some tricks to get the desired result. This priority qualifier is one of them, another is that paths are reverse sorted on string length before matching. This to make suffixes of otherwise identical rules stand out.

        Try to architect non-overlapping paths such that you don't require this extra parameter, we have it here mostly due to some legacy paths, that may need rework.

        Default:
        false

      • dataLoad

        public abstract boolean dataLoad
        Data load routes expect to receive a large body and they receive it piece by piece in HttpContent objects. See ArchiveTableRestHandler for an example on how to implement this. For the normal routes (where dataLoad=false) the body is limited to maxBodySize() bytes provided to the HttpObjectAgregator.
        Default:
        false

      • offThread

        public abstract boolean offThread
        Set true if the execution of the route is expected to take a long time (more than 0.5 seconds). It will be executed on another thread. Leave false if the execution uses its own off thread mechanism (most of the routes should do that).
        Returns:
        Default:
        false

      • maxBodySize

        public abstract int maxBodySize
        Default:
        65536
